name: Artillery Duel (itch)
description:
This is my very first game I've ever made! Please consider donating to help with further development on new projects. I am the kind of person that never asks for anything, and work hard for what I have got. I have a very modest income, and every small donation will have a large impact in my life. Thank you in advance.

Artillery Duel is a modern remake of the classic 1980's game that was created for the Colecovision, Bally Astrocade, and Atari. 

The game features both Pass & Play(2 people at same computer) where each player picks a color and you take turns shooting at the other player, or you can play single player vs. a Bot(AI). The AI tries its best, but a certain amount of randomness will occasionally cause it to make terrible shots depending on the terrain and wind conditions.

The goal of Artillery Duel is to observe the wind speed and direction, and alter your shot power and angle to compensate in order to attempt to hit your opponent. Terrain generation  and wind speed is random with each match.  Wind speed remains constant until one player is hit, and the change can drastically alter your shot trajectory. 

Once one player is hit twice, the round is over and a player is declared the winner.
